text: The British Journal of Clinical Psychology is a medical journal published by Wiley-Blackwell on behalf of the British Psychological Society covering topics in clinical psychology. It was established in 1981, when the British Journal of Social and Clinical Psychology split in two parts, the other being British Journal of Social Psychology. The editor-in-chief is Jessica Grisham (University of New South Wales). According to the Journal Citation Reports, the journal has a 2018 impact factor of 2.672, ranking it 38th out of 130 journals in the category "Psychology, Clinical". == References == == External links == * Category:Quarterly journals Category:English-language journals Category:Publications established in 1981 Category:Abnormal psychology journals Category:Clinical psychology journals Category:British Psychological Society academic journals Category:Psychotherapy journals
title: British Journal of Clinical Psychology
